archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Atcheson L. Hench World War II Papers
1936-1945

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Atcheson L. Hench World War II Papers, Accession #2504-g, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Mrs. Oscar W. Underwood, III, A.L. Hench's daughter, gave the papers to the Manuscripts Department on 1 January 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This addition to Atcheson L. Hench's World War II collection, (1936-1945), consists of 119 items, including the correspondence of Mr. and Mrs. Hench concerned with war, Mrs. Hench's speeches and programs for various organizations involved in the war effort, A.L. Hench's notes on University and community events during the war years, the Hench's ration book, Red Cross certificates and other awards, local and national war time publications, and newspaper clippings re the War.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: There are seven folders chronologically arranged.

did.unittitle:
Correspondence of A.L. and Virginia M. Hench re the War
1936-1946

scopecontent.p: Speeches, Publications re the War effort in Charlottesville, Va. collected by A.L. Hench

did.unittitle:
State, Federal, Foreign Wartime Publications re World War II
1940-1946

A.L. Hench's notes re WWII, the University and community
1942-1948

World War II Ration Books, Certificates, Awards of A.L. and Virginia Hench
1942-1944

Speeches, Programs, and Notes re the War effore by Virginia M. Hench
1943-1945
